PLAY.TITLE: The Tragedy of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark

PERSONAE.TITLE: Dramatis Personae
PERSONAE.PERSONA: HAMLET, son to the late, and nephew to the present king.
GERTRUDE, queen of Denmark, and mother to Hamlet.
Lords, Ladies, Officers, Soldiers, Sailors, Messengers, and other Attendants.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: FRANCISCO at his post. Enter to him BERNARDO

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, HAMLET,
POLONIUS, LAERTES, VOLTIMAND, CORNELIUS, Lords,
and Attendants

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. A room in Polonius' house.
SCENE IV. The platform.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: A flourish of trumpets, and ordnance shot off, within

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
SCENE I. A room in POLONIUS' house.
SCENE II. A room in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, ROSENCRANTZ,
GUILDENSTERN, and Attendants

Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and some
Attendants

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Re-enter POLONIUS, with VOLTIMAND and CORNELIUS

LINE.STAGEDIR: Pointing to his head and shoulder

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
Exeunt KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, and
Attendants

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Exit POLONIUS with all the Players but the First

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. A room in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, POLONIUS,
OPHELIA, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Danish march. A flourish. Enter KING CLAUDIUS,
QUEEN GERTRUDE, POLONIUS, OPHELIA, ROSENCRANTZ,
GUILDENSTERN, and others

Enter a King and a Queen very lovingly; the Queen
embracing him, and he her. She kneels, and makes
show of protestation unto him. He takes her up,
and declines his head upon her neck: lays him down
upon a bank of flowers: she, seeing him asleep,
leaves him. Anon comes in a fellow, takes off his
crown, kisses it, and pours poison in the King's
ears, and exit. The Queen returns; finds the King
dead, and makes passionate action. The Poisoner,
with some two or three Mutes, comes in again,
seeming to lament with her. The dead body is
carried away. The Poisoner wooes the Queen with
gifts: she seems loath and unwilling awhile, but
in the end accepts his love
Enter two Players, King and Queen
Pours the poison into the sleeper's ears
Exeunt all but HAMLET and HORATIO

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. A room in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. The Queen's closet.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Makes a pass through the arras

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Lifts up the array and discovers POLONIUS

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt severally; HAMLET dragging in POLONIUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. A room in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, ROSENCRANTZ,
and GUILDENSTERN

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Another room in the castle.
SCENE III. Another room in the castle.
SCENE IV. A plain in Denmark.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter FORTINBRAS, a Captain, and Soldiers, marching
Enter HAMLET, ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and others

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Elsinore. A room in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE, HORATIO, and a Gentleman

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Another room in the castle.
SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
SCENE I. A churchyard.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter HAMLET and HORATIO, at a distance

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
Enter Priest, & c. in procession; the Corpse of
OPHELIA, LAERTES and Mourners following; KING
CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, their trains, & c

SCENE.STAGEDIR: The Attendants part them, and they come out of the grave

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: HAMLET moves him to put on his hat

Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, LAERTES,
Lords, OSRIC, and Attendants with foils, & c
KING CLAUDIUS puts LAERTES' hand into HAMLET's

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Trumpets sound, and cannon shot off within

SCENE.STAGEDIR:
LAERTES wounds HAMLET; then in scuffling, they
change rapiers, and HAMLET wounds LAERTES

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: March afar off, and shot within

SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter FORTINBRAS, the English Ambassadors,
and others

A dead march. Exeunt, bearing off the dead
bodies; after which a peal of ordnance is shot off
